body:
# HTS.cr

[![CI](https://github.com/bio-crystal/hts/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/bio-crystal/hts/actions/workflows/ci.yml)
[![Slack](http://img.shields.io/badge/slack-bio--crystal-purple?labelColor=000000&logo=slack)](https://bio-crystal.slack.com/)
[![Get invite to BioCrystal](http://img.shields.io/badge/Get_invite_to_BioCrystal-purple?labelColor=000000&logo=slack)](https://join.slack.com/t/bio-crystal/shared_invite/zt-tas46pww-JSEloonmn3Ma5eD2~VeT_g)
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/351622305.svg)](https://zenodo.org/badge/latestdoi/351622305)

[Crystal](https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal) bindings for [HTSlib](https://github.com/samtools/htslib) that allows you to read and write file formats commonly used in genomics, such as [SAM, BAM, VCF, and BCF](http://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/).

:information_source: Method names will be changed to rust-htslib style in the next version.

## Requirements

* [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org)
* [HTSlib](https://github.com/samtools/htslib)
  * Ubuntu : `apt install libhts-dev`
  * macOS  : `brew install htslib`
  * Any OS : Build from [source code](https://github.com/samtools/htslib)
  * Make sure that `pkg-config` can detect htslib: `pkg-config --libs htslib`

## Installation

Add htslib to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     htslib:
       github: bio-crystal/hts
   ```

Run `shards install`

## Usage

SAM / BAM / CRAM

```crystal
require "hts/bam"

bam = HTS::Bam.open(bam_path)

bam.each do |r|
  p name:  r.qname,
    flag:  r.flag.value,
    pos:   r.pos + 1,
    mpos:  r.mpos + 1,
    mqual: r.mapping_quality,
    seq:   r.sequence,
    cigar: r.cigar,
    qual:  r.base_qualities.map { |i| (i + 33).chr }.join
  # tag:   r.tag("MC")
end

bam.close
```

VCF / BCF

```crystal
require "hts/bcf"

bcf = HTS::Bcf.open(bcf_path)

bcf.each do |r|
  p chrom:  r.chrom,
    start:  r.start,
    stop:   r.stop,
    id:     r.id,
    qual:   r.qual,
    filter: r.filter,
    ref:    r.ref,
    alt:    r.alt,
  # alleles r.alleles
  # info:   r.info,
  # format  r.format
end

bcf.close
```

## API Overview

* High level API - Create as needed. But don't overdo it.
* Low level API - Native C bindings to HTSLib generated by [crystal_lib](https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal_lib).
* See [API documentation](https://bio-crystal.github.io/hts/).

```
 ┌──────────────────── HTS ────────────────────┐
 │                                             │
 │ ┌─ Bam ────────┬─ Bcf ───────┬─ Tabix ────┐ │
 │ │ SAM BAM CRAM │ VCF BCF     │ TABIX      │ │
 │ └──────────────┴─────────────┴────────────┘ │
 │                     ┌─LibHTS2───────────┐   │
 │ ┌─LibHTS────────────┤ Macro functions   ├─┐ │
 │ │ Native C bindings └───────────────────┘ │ │
 │ └─────────────────────────────────────────┘ │
 └─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Related Work

* [ruby-htslib](https://github.com/kojix2/ruby-htslib)

## Contributing

:rocket: Feel free to fork it out! 
:hatching_chick: alpha stage.

hts is an immature, work-in-progress library, and pull requests such as small typo fixes are welcome.

    Do you need commit rights to hts?
    Do you want to get admin rights and take over the project?
    Please feel free to contact us @kojix2.

## Benchmark

https://github.com/brentp/vcf-bench

code: https://github.com/kojix2/vcf-bench/blob/kojix2/crystal-htslib/read.cr

def.name: open
def.body:
file = new(file_name, mode, index, fai, threads, create_index)
begin
  yield file
ensure
  file.close
end
file

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(file_name, mode, index, fai, threads, create_index)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: close
instance_methods.doc: Close the current file.

def.name: create_index
def.body:
if index_name == ""
  STDERR.puts("Create index for #{@file_name}")
  LibHTS.sam_index_build(@file_name, -1)
else
  STDERR.puts("Create index for #{@file_name} to #{index_name}")
  LibHTS.sam_index_build2(@file_name, index_name, -1)
end

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc:
Iterate over each record.
Record object is reused.
Faster than each_copy.

def.name: each
def.body:
bam1 = LibHTS.bam_init1
record = Record.new(bam1, header)
while (LibHTS.sam_read1(@hts_file, header.struct, bam1)) != -1
  yield record
end

instance_methods.name: each_copy
instance_methods.doc:
Iterate over each record.
Generate a new Record object each time.
Slower than each.

def.name: each_copy
def.body:
while (LibHTS.sam_read1(@hts_file, header.struct, bam1 = LibHTS.bam_init1)) != -1
  yield Record.new(bam1, header)
end

def.name: load_index
query
def.body:
if index_loaded?
else
  raise("Index file is required to call the query method.")
end
qiter = LibHTS.sam_itr_querys(@idx, header.struct, region)
begin
  bam1 = LibHTS.bam_init1
  slen = LibHTS2.sam_itr_next(@hts_file, qiter, bam1)
  while slen > 0
    yield Record.new(bam1, header)
    bam1 = LibHTS.bam_init1
    slen = LibHTS2.sam_itr_next(@hts_file, qiter, bam1)
  end
ensure
  LibHTS.hts_itr_destroy(qiter)
end

def.name: write
def.body:
new_record = record.clone
r = LibHTS.sam_write1(@hts_file, header.struct, new_record.struct)
r < 0 && (raise("Failed to write record: #{record}"))

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.
instance_methods.summary: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.

def.name: each
def.body:
@n_cigar.times do |i|
  c = @pointer[i]
  op = LibHTS2.bam_cigar_opchr(c)
  len = LibHTS2.bam_cigar_oplen(c)
  yield({op, len})
end

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Appends a short String representation of this object
which includes its class name and its object address.

```
class Person
  def initialize(@name : String, @age : Int32)
  end
end

Person.new("John", 32).to_s # => #<Person:0x10a199f20>
```

def.name: to_s
def.body:
each do |op, len|
  io << len
  io << op
end

instance_methods.name: base_at
instance_methods.doc: return only the base of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.
instance_methods.summary: return only the base of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.

def.name: base_at
def.body:
if n < 0
  n = n + @bam1.value.core.l_qseq
end
if (n >= @bam1.value.core.l_qseq) || (n < 0)
  return '.'
end
r = LibHTS2.bam_get_seq(@bam1)
SEQ_NT16_STR[LibHTS2.bam_seqi(r, n)]

instance_methods.name: base_qualities
instance_methods.doc: return the base qualities

def.name: base_qualities
def.body:
q_ptr = LibHTS2.bam_get_qual(@bam1)
Array.new(@bam1.value.core.l_qseq) do |i|
  q_ptr[i]
end

instance_methods.name: base_quality_at
instance_methods.doc: return only the base quality of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.
instance_methods.summary: return only the base quality of the requested index "i" of the query sequence.

def.name: base_quality_at
def.body:
if n < 0
  n = n + @bam1[:core][:l_qseq]
end
if (n >= @bam1[:core][:l_qseq]) || (n < 0)
  return 0
end
q_ptr = LibHTS.bam_get_qual(@bam1)
q_ptr.get_uint8(n)

instance_methods.summary: returns the chromosome or '' if not mapped.

def.name: chrom
def.body:
typeof(@bam1)
if tid == -1
  return ""
end
String.new(LibHTS.sam_hdr_tid2name(@header.struct, tid))

instance_methods.name: sequence
instance_methods.doc: return the read sequence

def.name: sequence
def.body:
r = LibHTS2.bam_get_seq(@bam1)
String.build do |seq|
  (@bam1.value.core.l_qseq).times do |i|
    seq << SEQ_NT16_STR[LibHTS2.bam_seqi(r, i)]
  end
end

instance_methods.name: stop
instance_methods.doc: returns end position of the read.

def.name: tag
def.body:
aux = get_aux_pointer(str)
if aux.null?
  return nil
end
t = aux.value
case t
when 'i', 'I', 'c', 'C', 's', 'S'
  LibHTS.bam_aux2i(aux)
when 'f', 'd'
  LibHTS.bam_aux2f(aux)
when 'Z', 'H'
  String.new(LibHTS.bam_aux2_z(aux))
when 'A'
  (LibHTS.bam_aux2_a(aux)).chr
end

  raise("Failed to format bam record")
end

record = Bcf::Record.new(bcf1, header)
while (LibHTS.bcf_read(@hts_file, header.struct, bcf1)) != -1

def.body:

  yield Bcf::Record.new(bcf1, header)

def.name: get_float
def.body:
n = Pointer(Int32).malloc
p1 = pointerof(@p1)
h = @record.header.struct
r = @record.struct
LibHTS.bcf_get_format_values(h, r, key, p1, n, HTS::LibHTS2::BCF_HT_REAL)
res = Pointer(Float32).new(@p1.address)
Array(Float32).new(n[0]) do |i|
  res[i]
end

def.name: get_int
def.body:
n = Pointer(Int32).malloc
p1 = pointerof(@p1)
h = @record.header.struct
r = @record.struct
LibHTS.bcf_get_format_values(h, r, key, p1, n, HTS::LibHTS2::BCF_HT_INT)
res = Pointer(Int32).new(@p1.address)
Array(Int32).new(n[0]) do |i|
  res[i]
end

def.name: to_s
def.body:
kstr = LibHTS::KstringT.new
if LibHTS.bcf_hdr_format(@bcf_hdr, 0, pointerof(kstr))
else
  raise("Failed to format header")
end
io << (String.new(kstr.s))

def.name: get_flag
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header.struct
r = @record.struct
case LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_flag(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)
when 1
  return true
when 0
  return false
when -1
  return nil
else
  raise("unknown return value")
end

def.name: get_float
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header.struct
r = @record.struct
if (LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_float(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)) < 0
  return nil
end
res = Pointer(Float32).new(@p1.address)
Array(Float32).new(ndst[0]) do |i|
  res[i]
end

def.name: get_int
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header.struct
r = @record.struct
if (LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_int32(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)) < 0
  return nil
end
res = Pointer(Int32).new(@p1.address)
Array(Int32).new(ndst[0]) do |i|
  res[i]
end

def.name: get_string
def.body:
ndst = Pointer(Int32).malloc
dst = pointerof(@p1)
hdr = @record.header.struct
r = @record.struct
if (LibHTS2.bcf_get_info_string(hdr, r, tag, dst, ndst)) < 0
  return nil
end
String.new(Pointer(UInt8).new(@p1.address))

def.name: alleles
def.body:
LibHTS.bcf_unpack(@bcf1, LibHTS2::BCF_UN_STR)
n = @bcf1.value.n_info_allele.bits(16..31)
Array(String).new(n) do |i|
  String.new(@bcf1.value.d.allele[i])
end

def.name: alt
def.body:
LibHTS.bcf_unpack(@bcf1, LibHTS2::BCF_UN_STR)
n = @bcf1.value.n_info_allele.bits(16..31)
Array(String).new(n - 1) do |i|
  String.new(@bcf1.value.d.allele[i + 1])
end

def.name: filter
def.body:
LibHTS.bcf_unpack(@bcf1, LibHTS2::BCF_UN_FLT)
d = @bcf1.value.d
n_flt = d.n_flt
case n_flt
when 0
  "PASS"
when 1
  i = d.flt.value
  String.new(LibHTS2.bcf_hdr_int2id(@header.struct, LibHTS2::BCF_DT_ID, i))
when 2
  StaticArray(String, 2).new do |i|
    j = d.flt[i]
    String.new(LibHTS2.bcf_hdr_int2id(@header.struct, LibHTS2::BCF_DT_ID, j))
  end
else
  raise("unexpectd number of filters. n_flt: #{n_flt}")
end

def.name: to_s
def.body:
ksr = LibHTS::KstringT.new
if (LibHTS.vcf_format(@header.struct, @bcf1, pointerof(ksr))) == -1
  raise("Failed to format record")
end
io << (String.new(ksr.s))

def.name: format_version
def.body:
v = (LibHTS.hts_get_format(@hts_file)).value.version
major = v.major
minor = v.minor
if minor == -1
  "#{major}"
else
  "#{major}.#{minor}"
end

def.name: seek
def.body:
flags = @hts_file.value.flags
if ((flags & ("1000".to_i(2))) != 0)
  LibHTS.cram_seek(@hts_file.value.fp.cram, offset, IO::SEEK_SET)
else
  if (  (flags & ("10000".to_i(2))) != 0)
    LibHTS.bgzf_seek(@hts_file.value.fp.bgzf, offset, IO::SEEK_SET)
  else
    LibHTS.hseek(@hts_file.value.fp.hfile, offset, IO::SEEK_SET)
  end
end

def.name: tell
def.body:
flags = @hts_file.value.flags
if ((flags & ("1000".to_i(2))) != 0)
  nil
else
  if (  (flags & ("10000".to_i(2))) != 0)
    LibHTS2.bgzf_tell(@hts_file.value.fp.bgzf)
  else
    LibHTS2.htell(@hts_file.value.fp.hfile)
  end
end

def.name: bcf_hdr_id2name
def.body:
if (hdr.null? || rid < 0) || rid >= hdr.value.n[LibHTS2::BCF_DT_CTG]
  raise("invalid rid")
end
(Pointer(LibHTS::BcfIdpairT).new((hdr.value.id[LibHTS2::BCF_DT_CTG]).address + ((sizeof(LibHTS::BcfIdpairT)) * rid))).value.key

def.name: sam_itr_next
def.body:
if itr.null?
  raise("Null iterator")
end
LibHTS.hts_itr_next(htsfp.value.fp.bgzf, itr, r, htsfp)
